channel.title: Java Forum
channel.description:
Well, ThatOneServer sent me his little code he had so far on it because of some code I needed. I looked back on it a few days ago and just started messing around. Since he practically gave up on it, I started working on it myself. Here is what I have come up with so far:
http://uppit.com/d/LTO3C
-Problems at hand --Getting the boardHandler working (I am planning on a complete rewrite when I get the chance) --Making the login system use a better method than String.contains("")
-To Do --Work on the clientside GUI system --Work on multiple file systems including SQL and XML --Make a serverside administration system --Start on Forums List
-Forums List --Make the BBC handler --Make the themeHandler --Work [i]heavily[/i] on the clientside GUI --Possibly make the themes cache (depending on whether or not a better method is introduced)
I am personally planning to work on this until the above list is completed. I will be adding several more tasks probably as the project advances. However, after my main goals are completed I will release it to the Mitb community and then leave ThatOneServer to continue development. All help is highly appreciated. Thank you.

item.title: Java Forum
item.dc:creator: @Stork Stork
item.description:
@Stork wrote:

Err, at what point is the server going to not be able to ping itself on port 80? If the webserver isn’t running, it doesn’t ping port 80 since it wont get any connections…

And yeah, text files are a lot harder to debug than databases. mysql -u root -p, connect forumdb, select id, name, date from users limit 50 is a lot quicker than opening file users.txt and scrolling down manually. You wouldn’t even be able to select specific columns…

Read full topic

item.title: Java Forum
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Stork, post:20, topic:95348”][quote author=Mod Taharok link=topic=137803.msg1345211#msg1345211 date=1179639669]

Why are you letting the user decide? Idea of forum software is the mechanics are hid from the user. Furthermore, text files and xml are totally inappropriate for this…

User as in admin, yes. User as in the common member, no.

Admins shouldn’t be allowed to choose, on the basis that they might do something stupid like decide to use xml or plain text for storing forum information. Flat file databases are WRONG.
“Furthermore, text files and xml are totally inappropriate for this…”

Not admins. Only the person who has access to the server itself can decide which file system it uses. You are missing the point altogether.
[/quote]
You’re right, I am. Why would you give someone the option of choosing a backend that’s horribly inefficient… and just wrong?
Also, why does your server status page report the uptime of localhost? Did it not occur to you that localhost is always up?[/quote]

The option of text files is not only for a quick debugger tool, but also for those who want to have a simpler way of navigating through saved data on the forum instead of going throw rows and rows and tables and tables of sql data.

Also, that is localhost of the server itself. Every time someone views that page the server pings itself.

newbiehacker:

If it’s going to look as bad as a simple swing GUI with LAF on, then I suggest u phail.

Thief suggested for me to build my own API for it, but I will have a lot of Java to learn for that.

Read full topic

And @moparisthebest on your reply on TOS’s last forum, that is exactly what I was planning. As much as everyone else is against me for doing, I am planning on having the user decide whether to use SQL, text files, or xml for storage.

item.title: Java Forum
item.dc:creator: @ThatOneServer Mike_
item.description:
@ThatOneServer wrote:

Give me a bit more credit? + make it look better. Heres what mine looked like. . .

[center][anchor=Links][b][u]Links[/u][/b] [iurl=#Links]Links[/iurl] [iurl=#Progress]Progress[/iurl] [iurl=#Status]Status[/iurl] [iurl=#Team]Project Team[/iurl] [iurl=#Details]Details[/iurl] [iurl=#Server_Progress]Server Progress[/iurl] [iurl=#Client_Progress]Client Progress[/iurl] [iurl=#Directory_Tree]Directory Tree[/iurl] [iurl=#Syntax]Syntax[/iurl] [iurl=#Further_Notes]Further Notes[/iurl] [iurl=#Images]Images[/iurl] [/center] [hr]

[center][anchor=Progress]Progress[/center]
04%
llllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllll

[hr]

[center][anchor=Status]Status[/center]
Need Partner Who Knows JavaXML

[hr]

[center][anchor=Team]Project Team[/center]
ThatOneServer(Leader)

[hr]

[center][anchor=Details]Project Details[/center]
I grow tired of Runescape Servers. Doing runescape servers, I feel restricted in my abilities. I have decided to work on a ‘Forum’ coded completely out of java. It will be accessed with a Java Applet, which will connect to a Java Server. The Java Server will then process information, and send it back. This information will be recieved by the Java Applet, which will de-encrypt that information, giving you a neat little GUI to look at.

[hr]

[center][anchor=Server_Progress]Server Progress[/center]
GUI(just a JTextArea with a void that appends text, Replaces system.out.println
Login(processing)[hr]
[center][anchor=Client_Progress]Client Progress[/center]
LoginGUI
Login(Sending)

[hr]

[center][u]Directory Tree/u[anchor=Directory_Tree][/center]
This is the directory tree:

Directory ForumTree // Categories --Categories.txt // lists boards name... used to load them --Directory Announcements // Announcements Category -- loaded from announcements.txt ----Boards.txt // Lists Board Names... used to load them ----Properties.xml // Category Properties Not sure exactly what it will load ----Directory News // News Board -- loaded from boards.txt ------properties.xml // Board Properties. . . Not sure exactly what will go here ------Directory Topics // All of the topics of the board. . . This folder name is NOT loaded --------1.xml // First Thread Ever(Last In List) --------TopicCount.xml // Used to order the topics --------Directory Stickied // Stickied Topics Go Here ----------1.xml //Every File In Here Has The ----------STopicCount.xml // Same Properties As the Above Ones.

[hr]

[center][u]Syntax/u[anchor=Syntax][/center]

<Topic> <Name>Name Of Topic</name> <User>Name Of User</user> <Date>Date Here</Date> <Message> The topic stuff will go here. . . </Message> </Topic> <Reply> <ReplyNumber>1</reply> <ReplyUser>Name Of User</user> <ReplyDate>Date Here</Date> <ReplyMessage> The topic stuff will go here. . . </ReplyMessage>

[hr]

[center]Further Notes[anchor=Further_Notes][/center]
I am not experienced in XML, so the syntax above will likely be completely different by the time the project is finished.

[hr]

[center][anchor=Images]Images[/center]
[center]

server.jpg698×302

[/center]

Read full topic
